column5:
Good news from the UK especially London, it appears that both critical and hospitalised cases are slowing down in the UK and flattening in London

I know this source is bad, it has the statistics from the COBRA meeting

[https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8200339/UK-announces-coronavirus-deaths.html](https://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-8200339/UK-announces-coronavirus-deaths.html)

>And that's the problem, isn't it?

Yes, but remember lots of people in the media and doomers in general enjoy seeing people scared because that will gain them attention.

I mean just look at the youtube channel peak prosperity for example, the guy had a very low view count before the virus came and then he started to fearmonger and dramatise it all and his view count shot up to the hundreds of thousands. And that guy has already been wrong about reinfection, worldwide chaos and R0 being over 4.

The death numbers are following the imperial college of London modelling, which is the same that revised it's death figure from 500 000 to 20 000.

I hope it's lower than 20 000 though.

I'm starting to get very annoyed of how the media are using the death of people under 30 to scare young people.

Here's some actual data and not anecdotal stories.

In the Netherlands

* 5% of 20-30 year old **confirmed** cases ***visited*** the hospital
* 10% of 30-40 year old **confirmed** cases ***visited*** the hospital

[https://www.rivm.nl/documenten/epidemiologische-situatie-covid-19-in-nederland-31-maart-2020-0](https://www.rivm.nl/documenten/epidemiologische-situatie-covid-19-in-nederland-31-maart-2020-0)

In Spain

* 2.5% of 20-30 year old **confirmed** cases were hospitalised (total hospitalised cases)
* 5% of 30-40 year old **confirmed** cases were hospitalised (total hospitalised cases)

[Source](https://www.isciii.es/QueHacemos/Servicios/VigilanciaSaludPublicaRENAVE/EnfermedadesTransmisibles/Documents/INFORMES/Informes%20COVID-19/Informe%20n%C2%BA%2017.%20Situaci%C3%B3n%20de%20COVID-19%20en%20Espa%C3%B1a%20a%2027%20marzo%20de%202020_revisado.pdf)

In the UK

* Around 2-3% of all critically ill covid-19 patients are under 30 (8% of all critically ill non-covid-19 patients are under 30)
* 8% are between 30-39 (similar figures compared to non-covid-19 viral pneumonia)
* 10-12% are between 40-50 (similar figures compared to non-covid-19 pneumonia)

[https://www.icnarc.org/About/Latest-News/2020/03/27/Report-On-775-Patients-Critically-Ill-With-Covid-19](https://www.icnarc.org/About/Latest-News/2020/03/27/Report-On-775-Patients-Critically-Ill-With-Covid-19)

And an update from Iceland

53 out of 1220 cases are either hospitalised or in ICU (around 4%)

236 recoveries

2 deaths

[https://www.covid.is/data](https://www.covid.is/data)

>We are five times the size of Italy. If we were Italy and did all those divisions, Italy should have close to 400,000 deaths. They are not close to achieving that. 

This line here is very reassuring.
Everytime I see a doomer use that term, they come across as being not smart but very obnoxious.

Journalists no longer care about reporting objectively but rather just use information to push a political agenda. These people should be ashamed of themselves for all the anxiety, panic and distress they have caused with fearmongering headlines and unverified information just for scoring political points.

>Dr. Brix

~~Source? And who is she ? Never heard of her.~~ Saw that RCL article below.

Also Neil Ferguson revised his death predictions from 500k to 20k.
Anyone else here who gets annoyed when doomers throw around the term exponentially to fearmonger and trying to sound intelligent.

Iceland the country which has done the most tests per capita is showing that only 20 out of 800 cases are in hospital or ICU.

Which would put hospitalisation rate at 2.1% and ICU at 0.03%.

2 deaths in Iceland with one of them dying from complications not related with covid-19

82 recoveries

https://www.icelandreview.com/ask-ir/whats-the-status-of-covid-19-in-iceland/

Some more context into his death

>While he was found to be infected with the coronavirus, it is unlikely to have been the cause of his death,” epidemiologist Dr Thorolfur Gudnason, the chief of the health directorate’s national vaccination program, told public broadcaster RUV. “His symptoms came on very quickly and were not those usually associated with Covid-19 deaths 

 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/20/coronavirus-australian-man-36-diagnosed-with-virus-dies-in-iceland](https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/mar/20/coronavirus-australian-man-36-diagnosed-with-virus-dies-in-iceland)

3243 people have recovered in Germany already.

 [https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/](https://www.worldometers.info/coronavirus/)

Fewer deaths and cases in Italy

Fewer cases in the UK

Fewer cases in Spain

Fewer cases in Switzerland

As more cases are detected in the US, the mortality rate is falling.

Yes

Milan fake audio

Really sad to see people are so desperate to dramatise this and make people even more panicked and worried.

>people are just desperate right now to find some good news

As if people aren't also desperate for this to be bad, just look at the users posting on r/china_flu

And what about all these fake anonymous "doctors" spreading horror stories that turn out to be fake, for example the Seattle critical doctor and Milan audio fake stories.
I would avoid r/coronavirusuk as it is a mix of r/coronavirus and r/china_flu.

Does anyone else just find these graphs so damn annoying

/jburnmurdoch/status/1240723388336877569 (twitter)

These italy style projections are the new silly super exponential doomer growth projections that we saw back in January which turned out to be extremely wrong.

Sad to see people dying, but so much for the "wait 4 weeks and 20-30 year olds will start dying".

As of now there have been zero deaths for under 30s in South Korea and Italy

Yea the scum have moved over to scare young people now, they will keep on trying to scaremonger until it hits them or someone they know personally.

I have avoided that sub, and my mental health has only gone up.

> "And here we go" "Buckle up, boys, we're in for a bumpy ride!" "Give it two weeks" I'm going to scream 

Or the snarky comments like "just a flu, bro", "it only affects the elderely" and "EXPONENTIAL GROWTH" . Those people are pure scum. When this is over I really want those fuckers to be shamed.

This is a very good video summarising the UK strategy.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nl6tTwxzCi8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nl6tTwxzCi8)

I don't like Boris Johnson, but the media are fearmongering and spreading misinformation just to play political games. I would be in no doubt that we would see a similar strategy if Corbyn won the election.

​

>For my U.K. friends, Boris Johnson announced today that they are changing their strategy from the old one to one which more closely resembles what the rest of the world is doing. Expect to see more good news, policies, and plans to start rolling out this week.

Honestly, I don't like Boris but the British media were straight out lying and fearmongering with the herd immunity and allowing everyone to be infected. The whole plan was to flatten the curve and it still is. It's very ineffective to close down everything when the risk of infection is still very low.

In my view the UK has been handling this way better than the rest of the world bar South Korea, Singapore, Taiwan and Hong Kong.

This is a very good video summarising the UK strategy

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nl6tTwxzCi8](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nl6tTwxzCi8)

By the way thanks for posting this.

I'm seeing quite a lot posts on r/coronavirus about under-50 people ending up in ICU in countries like the Netherlands and France(under 60). It's starting to drive me mad and for me it just confirms many people on there are a bunch sad pathetic fucks who want the world to collapse. They'll wish for this to be bad until it hits them personally. Problem is that both of these countries are no longer testing mild cases. 

They have a new snarky comment "it'll only affects the elderly badly", but yet they ignore that medical experts in both France and the Netherlands says the risk for ICU is lower the younger you are.

Also there are scumbags on that sub celebrating that people are panic buying and panicking in general because for them it means they are finally WaKiNg Up AnD tAkInG It SeRiOuSlY. 

When this is over I want these fuckers to be shamed.
And the doctors who say they see young people also add that it's usual for influenza and it's very low risk.

Be on the watch, I have noticed a lot of so called anonymous """"doctors"""" popping up from all over the place saying healthy fit young people ending up icu.

Expect more unverifiable stuff like this in the coming weeks. 90% of these so called frontline doctors will be fearmongering doomers spreading rumours

And I have seen a lot of medical experts believe what these anonymous fake doctors are saying.

These mostly fake stories about healthy young people in ICU will replace the fake random videos of people collapsing in Wuhan.
Oh you need to manually copy and paste that link in your web/search bar and then remove the spaces i put between www. facebook .com because this sub won't let me post facebook posts link.

Was it this post?

https://www. facebook .com/559600188/posts/10157623212885189/?app=fbl

>The post I read had some Italian woman claiming there were tons of 18 year olds in the ICU

Who's been spreading that now?

Edit: found the post, the author said that younger people are coming in seeking treatment, this could mean anything. But of course doomers twist it and associate treatment with needing ICU.

Or the whole post could be the author falling for misinformation, because the author cites the fake audio from Milan.

I knew that doomers would have start to focus their fearmongering campaign on the young.

Edit: The woman isn't even Italian by the way she has an american who happens to live in Italy.

>I keep seeing people reposting from people from Italy everywhere saying their mortality rate is 6-8%??

Italy has just been unlucky, first there was a hospital outbreak so you had a bunch of people who already are sick, then testing positively for the virus. Secondly the demographics of the Italian cases skew heavily towards those who are elderly and have underlying health conditions. Third Italy counts everyone who tests positive but dies as a covid-19 death despite that many of those deaths could be attributed for other diseases and reasons. The Italians authorities even admitted that they are going review the cause of death for many people who are dying in this outbreak.

Italy is getting a lot of attention from the media due to this, but the media has barely mentioned the low mortality rate in Germany, Scandinavia and South Korea.

So by peak do they mean that 50% will be infected in the next two weeks?

Sorry if my questions sounds stupid.

So

The green = total recovered

The black = total deaths

Top Red = confirmed cases

Bottom red = active cases

Orange = suspected cases

Purple = cases that are in serious or critical condition

so in the green tab there was +1320 which means that today that many people were discharged

And the same applies to the black tab so that 11+ means 11 people died today.

I really hope you're right, because the fatality rate in South Korea is slowly ticking upwards(not trying to scare anyone, majority of those deaths appeared to have other diseases, very unfortunate situation for some people).

Germany seems to have an even lower mortality rate than Korea though.

All these closings and cancellations of everything just makes me more anxoius and thinking maybe this truly is the worst-case scenario :(.

https://news.qq.com/zt2020/page/feiyan.htm#/

1320(recoveries) + 11(deaths) = 1331 completed cases.

11/1331 = 0.8
The daily completed case fatality rate is now below 1% in China, 0.82% to be more precise.
No need to be hostile. I didn't mean to be disingenuous.

What happened to that one death in the 40s?

Also still surprised to see that only 23% cases are still under 50.

Would be interesting to see if vaping has any effect on how the disease can progress.

Maybe it could explain why a couple under 25s end up in ICU:

By the looks of it vaping does increase the risk for pneumonia (in general, not covid-19 related yet)

[https://www.statnews.com/2019/09/06/vaping-cases-rising-dont-know-cause/](https://www.statnews.com/2019/09/06/vaping-cases-rising-dont-know-cause/)

> It has now been shown that active and passive tobacco smoke seriously damages health and also promotes respiratory infections.  
>  
>We are therefore not surprised that recent studies of Covid-19 have shown a more severe disease risk among smokers. A third more of Covid-19 positive smokers had a more serious clinical situation than non-smokers upon admission, and for them the risk of needing intensive care and mechanical ventilation is more than double. These studies also speculate that the smoker's condition explains the gender difference in the reported lethality rate which would be 4.7% in men versus 2.8% in women. In fact, the prevalence of smokers in China is very high and exceeds 50% while that of women is less than 3%.  
>  
>Ceasing to consume any tobacco product is therefore even more important today.  
>  
>In Italy there are 11.6 million smokers, 22% of the population over the age of 15. There are over 7 million men who smoke and 4.5 million women. Among students aged between 14 and 17, 11.1% and 13.4% occasionally smoke.  
>  
>Attempts to quit smoking have been on the decline in recent years but scientific research has confirmed that when you quit smoking, you will get many short and long term benefits. After a few weeks the respiratory gas exchange of the circulation improves, the cough and respiratory problems improve.  
>  
>Quitting smoking is possible In Italy we have Anti-Smoking Centers, present all over the national territory, where specialists are able to help smokers in the process of cessation of the consumption of tobacco products also through personalized interventions. We use the need for changes in daily habits, which this epidemic imposes on us, to mature the need to abandon the consumption of tobacco and nicotine products. Call the Green Telephone against smoking 800 554088, active from Monday to Friday from 10 to 16 for information and support for change.

yes all.

Flu has a r0 of 1.2

Swine Flu had a r0 of 1.4-1.6

Some more Swine flu comparisons, I know the flu comparisons can be bad, but it can really show how the IFR(infected fatality rate) can be much lower than the CFR(case fatality rate).

USA - Swine Flu

Confirmed cases: 115,318

Hospitalisations: 27,632 (23%)

CFR: 2.9%

IFR: below 0.2%

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009\_flu\_pandemic\_in\_the\_United\_States](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_flu_pandemic_in_the_United_States)

USA - Covid-19

Confirmed cases: 976

Hospitalisations:?

CFR: 3%

Ifr: 0.3-1.8%

4124

Kind of good news from Italy

>As regards virus-related mortality, the updated data confirm those of the first study. The mean age of deceased and COVID-19 positive patients is 81.4. There are 48 women (31.0%). The average number of pathologies observed in this population is 3.6. Deaths occur mostly after 80 years and in people with important pre-existing diseases: in detail, mortality is 14.3% over 90 years, 8.2% between 80 and 89, 4% between 70 and 79, 1.4% between 60 and 69 and 0.1% between 50 and 59, while there are no deaths under this age group. Overall, 21 patients (15.5% of the sample) had 0 or 1 pathology, 25 (18.5%) had 2 pathologies and 70 (60.3%) had 3 or more pathologies; for 19 patients it has not yet been possible to recover the information.

[Source](https://www.iss.it/web/guest/primo-piano/-/asset_publisher/o4oGR9qmvUz9/content/id/5289474)

Yes the data is a bit outdated, but it's about age group mortality, not general mortality rate.

**Lethality in Italy less than that of China for all age groups**

>Iss, March 6, 2020 For all age groups, the lethality rate from Covid-19 in Italy is lower than that currently recorded in China. A comparison between the Chinese and Italian data produced by the Istituto Superiore di Sanità, according to which even the current general lethality in our country is lower than that which was had in China in the first phase of the epidemic, finds it.  
>  
>In Italy on 4 March lethality (calculated as the number of deaths on confirmed cases) among the over 80s was 10.9%, while in China on 24 February (latest available data, extracted from the report of the joint China-WHO commission) was by 14.8%. Between 70 and 79 years the comparison sees Italy with a lethality of 5.3%, while China has 8%, and between 0 and 69 it is 0.5% in our country against 1.3% in China . As regards lethality in general, on March 4 in Italy it was 3.5%, while in China on February 24 it was 2.3%.  
>  
>"The comparison dispels the commonplace that is circulating these days which states that in our country mortality is higher than in China - says Silvio Brusaferro, president of the ISS -. The data goes to all thanks to our National Health System and to our operators and professionals that I want to thank for the precious, tireless work they are guaranteeing day after day. Let's not forget that Italy has a much higher average age than for example China (44.3 years versus 37.4) and this puts even more pressure on the structures and operators in the areas affected by the epidemic ".
